slug.description: A unique URL-friendly identifier for your course. Example: `redis`.

name.description: The name of your course. Example: `Build your own Redis`.

short_name.description: A short name for your course. Example: `Redis`.

release_status.description: The release status of your course. Accepted values: `alpha`, `beta`, `live`.

description_md.description: A markdown description for your course. 25-50 words.

short_description_md.description: A short description of your course, < 15 words.

completion_percentage.description: The percentage of users who complete this course. Set to 5% if we don't have data yet.

slug.description: Slug for the language. Example: `python`. Full list of languages available [here](https://backend.codecrafters.io/api/v1/languages).

difficulty.description: The difficulty of the course. Accepted values: `easy`, `medium`, `hard`.

sample_extension_idea_title.description: A title for the sample extension idea. Example: `Geospatial Queries`

sample_extension_idea_description.description: A description for the sample extension idea. Example: `A Redis server that can respond to geospatial queries`

slug.description: A unique identifier for this stage. Your tester will reference this value. Example: `init`

name.description: The name of this stage. Example: `Respond to PING`

description_md.description: A markdown description for this stage, rendered in the 'Your Task' card.

difficulty.description:
A difficulty rating for this stage, from the perspective of a proficient programmer.

- `very_easy`: <5m
- `easy`: 5-10m 
- `medium`: 30m-1h
- `hard`: >1h

marketing_md.description: A short markdown description of this stage, used in the course overview page.

tester_source_code_url.description: Link to the source code for the test cases of this stage. Optional.
